['bib']abstract: Software size estimation is the process applied to develop a prediction for the amount of source code required to implement a software application. This estimate is fundamental to determining the resources and schedule needed to implement a system. Present estimation approaches are based upon research and model from the 1970's and do not embrace present day life cycle models nor engineering tools. A new model for software size estimation is introduced within this dissertation to accommodate graphical user interfaces
['bib']title: GUI-point analysis: a new model for software size estimation

['bib']title: Guidelines for the Service-Development within Service-oriented Architectures

['bib']title: Inclusion of Functional and Non-Functional Parameters for the Prediction of Overall Efforts of Mobile Applications.

['bib']title: Leveraging Open-Source Data for Software Cost Estimation: A Predictive Modeling Approach

['bib']title: Measurement of software development productivity

['bib']title: Software Project Planning: The Relationship between Project Planning and Project Success

['bib']title: Task-based estimation and planning for application development projects and resources: Models, methods and applications

['bib']title: Value Estimation of Software Functional Test Cases
